item.title: Remembering the Stardust: A Vintage Vegas Icon's Rise and Fall
item.description:
A Star is Born: The Stardust’s Grand Entrance

The Las Vegas Strip wouldn’t be what it is today without the Stardust Hotel and Casino. Opened on July 2, 1958, it was a behemoth. Imagine: 1,065 rooms, a sprawling 16,500 square foot casino, and a whopping 60 acres of land! It was, quite simply, the largest hotel in the world at the time. The story began with Tony Cornero, who initially spearheaded the project. Following his untimely death in 1955, his brother took over until Rella Factor finalized the deal and brought the Stardust to life. Its sheer scale set it apart, and its location – just south of the burgeoning center of the Strip – cemented its place in Las Vegas history.
